name: Joey Ayala
description: '''José Íñigo Homer Lacambra Ayala''' (born June 1, 1956), professionally known as '''Joey Ayala''', is a Filipino singer-songwriter. A former journalist and [[copywriter]], Ayala is considered among the most prominent [[Philippine folk music|folk musicians]] in the Philippines. He previously served as the chairman of the music committee of the [[National Commission for Culture and the Arts]]. He is well known for his style of music that combines the sounds of [[Philippines|Filipino]] ethnic instruments with modern [[pop music]]. His public music life started when he released an album recorded in a makeshift studio in 1982 in [[Davao City]]. To date, he has released fourteen albums.
